Authors:
M. L. Creaser, Pedro W. Crous, Francois Halleen, Lizel
Mostert
Title:
Cryptovalsa ampelina, a forgotten shoot and cane pathogen of
grapevines.
Abstract:
A diatrypaceous ascomycete with polysporous asci and
reniform to allantoid, pigmented ascospores, was commonly isolated from
grapevine canes in South Africa and Australia. The fungus was identified
as Cryptovalsa ampelina based on its characteristic morphology.
Subsequent phylogenetic analyses confirmed this species to belong to the
Diatrypaceae. To elucidate its status as potential pathogen,
pathogenicity was also confirmed by means of wound inoculations on
grapevine canes.
